intro: Cleistes aphylla, commonly known as the naked-flowered cleistes, is a rare and delicate herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its small, showy, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Cleistes aphylla is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and wetlands.
